result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy G Bock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy G Bock is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy G Bock was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge= $543, apply cash bond, remainder to be paid in $40 per month installments commencing on 7/28/16 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 30  days in Jefferson County Jail, with work release/Huber privileges for work and treatment purposes; to commence no later than  5/31/ 2016 at 
6:00pm  

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

The Court determines that Mr. Bock has already provided a DNA sample, does not order another.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Case called at 8:12am [mo]
Defendant Jeremy G Bock in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Agreement of the Parties, the Court dismisses Count #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30  days in Jefferson County Jail, with work release/Huber privileges for work and treatment purposes; to commence no later than  5/31/ 2016 at 6:00pm

--0 days credit

--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge= $543, apply cash bond, remainder to be paid in $40 per month installments commencing on 7/28/16 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court determines that Mr. Bock has already provided a DNA sample, does not order another. 
recess: 8:32am
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2016 at 08:10 am.
Conflict Review Worksheet--No Conflict Found

Case called at 10:33am [mo]
Defendant Jeremy G Bock in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute/DA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Bock. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Humes indicate that a resolution has been reached. 

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess: 10:39am

Case called at 11:35 am [sf]
Defendant Jeremy G Bock in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Court verifies DOB and address info.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered on defendant's behalf; Court preserves the defendant's right to request substitution of Judge as long as it's done within the next ten days; Court preserves the right to a speedy trial  within the next 10 days; otherwise it will be waived.

Court continues the $150.00 CASH bond, with additional conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Krystle Harris

recess: 11:39 am
